member.name: M:Linetime.Database.ADOdotNET.ADORetries.RetryOnThisError(System.Exception,System.Int32@,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection@)
member.summary: This routine is used to handle specific timeout and network related errors when opening connections or processing ADO commands
member.remarks: This routine will display a retry dialog box when network issues or timeouts arise, giving the user a chance to re-submit what they're doing without it crashing out. Most timeouts or network errors are recoverable once the server is back online or, in the case of timeouts, the blocks/locks on the server have gone (or whatever was grinding the server to a halt has finished) See S036240 for extensive details

member.name: M:Linetime.Database.ADOdotNET.Executes.ExecuteNonQuery(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.String,System.Data.CommandType,System.Object[],System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This function attempts to execute a query against the connection.
member.returns: It follows the standard rules of executequery i.e. 0 = nothing done, positive = number of rows affected. Compound Queries return -2 for success or -1 for fail
member.remarks: Returning -1 indicates a failure to connect to the database or an sql exception when executing.

member.name: M:Linetime.Database.ADOdotNET.Executes.ExecuteTransactionNonQuery(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection@,System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlTransaction@,System.Data.CommandType,System.Object[],System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: This function attempts to execute a transaction query against the connection.
member.returns: It follows the standard rules of executequery i.e. 0 = nothing done, positive = number of rows affected. Compound Queries return -2 for success or -1 for fail
member.remarks: Returning -1 indicates a failure to connect to the database or an sql exception when executing.
